publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-3115 Ms Sandra White: University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course-That the Parliament congratulates the University of Glasgow on its decision to recommence the honours level course in Scottish politics; believes that in this post-devolution era this course is a great asset to the Scottish academic and political community and hopes to see the continuation of this course for many years to come, and congratulates Professor Chris Berry and the excellent Politics Department at the university for taking on board the representations of many who were concerned at the loss of this course.
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Michael Matheson*, Dorothy-Grace Elder*

S1M-3115 Ms Sandra White: University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course-That the Parliament congratulates the University of Glasgow on its decision to recommence the honours level course in Scottish politics; believes that in this post-devolution era this course is a great asset to the Scottish academic and political community and hopes to see the continuation of this course for many years to come, and congratulates Professor Chris Berry and the excellent Politics Department at the university for taking on board the representations of many who were concerned at the loss of this course. Supported by: Michael Matheson, Dorothy-Grace Elder
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Tommy Sheridan*, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Shona Robison*
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Michael Russell*, Nora Radcliffe*
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Fergus Ewing*
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Alex Neil*
S1M-3115 University of Glasgow Scottish Politics Course (lodged on 15 May 2002) Mr Keith Raffan*
